action.action-desc: Mr. O'Halleran (for himself and Mr. Westerman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 to modify the appointment and composition of resource advisory committees.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the RAC Reform Act of 2017.

section.header: Composition and appointment of resource advisory committees

subsection.text: Section 205 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7125) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking The Secretary concerned and inserting The applicable department official; and
in paragraph (3) by striking the Secretary concerned and inserting the applicable department official;

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(6), by striking the Secretary concerned and inserting the applicable department official;

subparagraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking by the Secretary and inserting by the applicable department official;

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking The Secretary concerned, and inserting Except as provided in subparagraph (C), the applicable department official;
in subparagraph (B), by striking The Secretary concerned and inserting Except as provided in subparagraph (C), the applicable department official; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: For purposes of applying the 4-year term limit under subparagraphs (A) and (B) to a member of a resource advisory committee, the applicable department official shall not count as a year of the member’s term any year of service the majority of which was served during a fiscal year for which the budget of the resource advisory committee was less than $1,000,000.
in paragraph (2), by striking The Secretary concerned and inserting The applicable department official;
in paragraph (4), by striking The Secretary concerned and inserting The applicable department official; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: In this section, the term applicable department official means—

subparagraph.text: with respect to Federal land described in section 3(7)(A), the applicable Regional Forester; and
with respect to Federal land described in section 3(7)(B), the applicable Bureau of Land Management State Director.
in paragraph (1), by striking 15 members and inserting 9 members;
in paragraph (2), by striking 5 persons each place it appears and inserting 3 persons; and
by striking the Secretary concerned both places it appears and inserting the applicable department official; and
by striking the Secretary concerned and inserting the applicable department official; and
by striking the Secretary and inserting the applicable department official.

subsection.text: Section 201(3)(A) of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7121(3)(A)) is amended by inserting or applicable department official (as defined in section 205(c)(6)) after Secretary concerned.
